text: "The correctional system hasn't adapted to the large increase in incarcerated women, according to study author Dr. Carolyn Sufrin (@cbsufrin), an OB-GYN at @HopkinsMedicine."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “While several studies point to improved pain control with medical marijuana, research has largely ignored older adults even though they experience the highest rates of medical issues that could be treated with medical marijuana” – @JHSPH_HPM's @LHNicholas
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "The study, titled 'The Effect of Medical Marijuana Laws on Health and Labor Supply,' appeared in the Spring 2019 edition of @JPAM_DC. It suggests medical marijuana laws may improve the health and employment prospects of older Americans."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text:
Global Health NOW (@ghn_news) is headed west next month for its third live event.
 
This time, they're partnering with the @Stanford Refugee Research Project to present Rise with Refugees: Responding to an Urgent and Accelerating Global Crisis.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "The price reductions could also be a boon for Medicaid, the U.S. health care program for the poor. Four in 10 non-elderly adults with opioid addiction are covered by Medicaid, according to the @KaiserFamFound."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "For decades, health insurance costs for employers and workers have risen faster than inflation, despite various efforts to rein them in."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Hi Dr. Bilal, We sincerely regret the error! After seeing your tweet, we've gone ahead and updated the mailing database on our end. Thank you for bringing the issue to our attention!
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: The Association of Schools & Programs of Public Health (@ASPPHtweets) has named @JohnsHopkinsSPH the recipient of the 2019 Harrison C. Spencer Award for Outstanding Community Service.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “With bold leadership, shared responsibility, and smart investments based on sound science, we can end TB within a generation,” write @MikeReidMD and @GYamey in an exclusive commentary for @GHN_News.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "In states where medical marijuana is legal, researchers reported a reduction of pain and an increase in worked hours by residents older than 51 who use the alternative medicine, according to a new study released by @JohnsHopkinsSPH and @TempleUniv." https://www.wmar2news.com/news/health/medical-marijuana-may-increase-productivity-in-older-adults-bloomberg-study-suggests …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "It’s potentially a really big deal," said @JHSPH_HPM faculty @BrendanSaloner, adding that treating patients with Suboxone Film "cuts their risk of overdose in half." https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-20/america-s-best-weapon-in-the-opioid-epidemic-just-got-cheaper …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "I very much hope to see more women in senior positions at the WHO," @MoetiTshidi, @WHO's regional director for Africa, tells @IVACtweets director William Moss in a conversation for @JohnsHopkinsSPH's magazine.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "We need a way to help scientists organize and preserve, not just index, knowledge," writes @JohnsHopkinsEPI professor @KayDickersin.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "U.S. emergency departments are seeing a surge in the number of kids and teens seeking help for mental health problems, new research warns."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "The work that @ColleenBridger is doing is really non-negotiable," says San Antonio Mayor @Ron_Nirenberg in this episode of the @AmericanHealth podcast with @DrJoshS, which explores how and why San Antonio has embraced policies supported by @City_Health.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "The analysis revealed that while there had been about 31 psychiatric-related visits to the ER for every 1,000 Americans between the ages of 6 and 24 back in 2011, that figure had risen to more than 40 by 2015." https://www.usnews.com/news/health-news/articles/2019-03-18/more-us-teens-kids-seeking-mental-health-care-in-ers …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “I’m trying to explore the potential for phthalates to exert selective pressure on the microbial communities in the home and in the child” to promote disease, says @JohnsHopkineEHE faculty @MeghanDavisDVM.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "In America, becoming a doctor can prove fatal," writes @JohnsHopkinsSPH MHS alumna @DrAmithaMD. In an article for the @BostonGlobe, Dr. Kalaichandran reports on the costs of bullying in medicine, and steps everyone can take to change the culture.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: On the @AmericanHealth podcast, @DrJoshS talks with San Antonio Mayor @Ron_Nirenberg and Health Commissioner @ColleenBridger about how and why they've embraced @City_Health, a national effort to advance evidence-based policies at the city level. http://americanhealth.libsyn.com/tbd
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "@MeghanDavisDVM and colleagues are investigating how disinfectants and other chemicals found in the home can affect MRSA. The work is starting to show that disinfectants might exert selective pressure on S. aureus, leading to multidrug-resistant strains." https://cen.acs.org/environment/persistent-pollutants/Linking-pollution-infectious-disease/97/i11 …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "We look forward to working with our colleagues ... around the world to confront the evolving 'triple burden' with an expanded arsenal of public health strategies," writes @JohnsHopkinsSPH Dean @EllenJMacKenzie.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "@MeghanDavisDVM, an assistant professor with @JohnsHopkinsEHE, is investigating how various chemicals that people encounter every day affect methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA), leading to multidrug-resistant strains."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Pre-K is a policy that, if enacted across the U.S., would really improve public health," says San Antonio Health Commissioner @ColleenBridger in this episode of the @AmericanHealth podcast with @DrJoshS, which looks at policies supported by @City_Health.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "We use the expression 'just show up' at the @Nov_Project frequently," writes @MarvinTheTorch, a @JohnsHopkinsSPH MPH student who founded @Nov_Proj_Balt. "That's the first step in whatever we hope to achieve—in public health or in life."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "What is happening in Greece is that organizations and service providers focus mostly on the basic needs of children—shelter, food and medical care," says @HarvardFxb's Vasileia Digidiki. "However we tend to ignore the agency of these children..."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Diabetes was associated with a 35 percent higher likelihood of reporting back pain, in an analysis of five studies with a total of 131,431 people, and with a 24 percent greater risk of neck pain, according to two studies with 6,560 people."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: It's not enough for autonomous vehicles to be safe. @JohnsHopkinsSPH faculty are also making sure they're equitable.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “No one should have to make a choice between their health and their money. Yet breast cancer survivors face incredibly high prices that can lead to severe financial hardships, even bankruptcy,” says lead author @DrLTDean.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Participants between the ages of 18 to 34 were particularly likely to rely on label dates to discard food. More than half of participants incorrectly thought date labeling was federally regulated or reported being unsure."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Last year, @JohnsHopkinsSPH student Md Zohirul Alam wanted to document the diversity of public health in Bangladesh, so with Gonoshasthaya Kendra and #GonoUniversity, he launched the country's first-ever public health photo contest.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "As date labeling becomes standardized, this research underlines the need for a strong communications campaign and highlights a particular need for education among those ages 18 to 34," says @LivableFuture's @RNeff1, who analyzed survey results. https://hub.jhu.edu/2019/03/14/misunderstanding-food-labels-waste/ …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “Given that smoke detectors are an effective way to drastically reduce the number of fire deaths, it is concerning that venues that allow smoking would be less likely to be equipped with smoke detectors,” says lead author @SafePhD.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “In many parts of the country fentanyl is now the major cause of all the death and despair arising from the opioid epidemic, and we have to reduce the barriers that prevent users from being prepared to treat fentanyl overdoses” – Carl Latkin
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: The @USDA estimates that 31% of food may be wasted at the retail and consumer levels, and a recent analysis by @LivableFuture researchers indicates that widespread confusion about "use by" dates could be a factor. https://hub.jhu.edu/2019/03/14/misunderstanding-food-labels-waste/ …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Standard cell cultures can't necessarily capture how Toxoplasma behaves in humans. To advance her research on the parasite, @JohnsHopkinsMMI's Isabelle Coppens looked one block down the road, where @HopkinsMedicine's Gabsang Lee had developed "mini guts."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "The researchers found that among labels assessed, "Best if used by" was most frequently perceived as communicating quality, while "use by" was one of the top two perceived as communicating safety. But many had different interpretations." https://hub.jhu.edu/2019/03/14/misunderstanding-food-labels-waste/ …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Providing evidence-based treatment during detention and ensuring coordinated care after release will put people on the path to recovery," write @JHSPH_CMHAPR postdoc Sachini Bandara and #JHSPH MPH students Jenny Wen and N. Jia Ahmad in the @BaltimoreSun.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: A recent survey examining U.S. consumer attitudes and behaviors related to food date labels, which was analyzed by @LivableFuture researchers, found widespread confusion, leading to unnecessary discards, increased waste, and food safety risks. https://hub.jhu.edu/2019/03/14/misunderstanding-food-labels-waste/ …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: To improve demographic accuracy, @helleringer143 is exploring the use of machine learning and computer vision—teaching computers to analyze and extract data from images—to estimate age in LMICs with deficient demographic data.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: At the #AmericanHealthSummit, @BloombergDotOrg unveiled a $50 million plan to provide resources and expertise to help states affected by the opioid epidemic implement comprehensive public health strategies. Today, Michigan became the second state.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text:
The Spring 2019 issue of Hopkins Bloomberg #PublicHealth is out! 

This issue explores:

• Dean @EllenJMacKenzie's column on the "triple burden" of disease
• Improving autonomous vehicles to advance mobility for everyone
• "Disarming a Brain Bomb"
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "We look forward to working with our colleagues ... around the world to confront the evolving 'triple burden' with an expanded arsenal of public health strategies," writes @JohnsHopkinsSPH Dean @EllenJMacKenzie.

text: "Cases of malaria, dengue fever, Zika and other serious illnesses have reached alarming levels in Venezuela and are spilling over into neighboring countries, according to several recent studies."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "[Dan] Polsky, a national leader in the field of health policy and economics, has dedicated his career to exploring how health care is organized, managed, financed, and delivered—especially for low-income people."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "The vaccine hesitancy movement has really reached this level in certain countries — the U.S., European countries, even in the Philippines — where we now are having difficult-to-control measles outbreaks occur, because the level of immunity has fallen."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "The issue I care most about is how to make sure people who need access to health care get the care they need," says @HealthEcon_Dan, a new member of the @JHU_BDPs with join placements in @JohnsHopkinsSPH and @JHUCarey. https://hub.jhu.edu/2019/03/12/daniel-polsky-health-economics-bloomberg-distinguished-professor/ …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "We rely on successes in the past to help us maintain good public health," says @JHSPH_CHS scholar @skirkell. "If those practices stop, we start sliding back—and it takes a lot of effort to arrest that backward momentum and get to where we were before." https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/infectious-diseases-spike-amid-venezuelas-political-turmoil/ …

text: “If female researchers are receiving less funding then the issues that female researchers are studying are receiving less money,” says @JohnsHopkinsIH assistant scientist @RosemaryJMorgan.

text: "Across the full sample of venues ... in the analysis—both smoking and non-smoking—63% reported having smoke detectors in their Airbnb profile. The lowest prevalence of smoke detectors was among venues in Italy (2%) and the highest was in Scotland (83%)."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: In a study analyzing listings across 17 countries, #JHSPH researchers found that less than half of Airbnb venues that allow smoking are equipped with smoke detectors, while nearly two-thirds of Airbnb venues that do not allow smoking have smoke detectors. https://www.jhsph.edu/news/news-releases/2019/multi-country-study-many-airbnb-listings-that-allow-smoking-lack-smoke-detectors.html …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "These are confounding times when it comes to vaccines."

text: .@JohnsHopkinsSPH has again been named the top public health school in the nation by @USNews.

text: We support it! After all, both GoT and epidemiology owe a lot to the work of Jo(h)n Snow

text: "A new study published in @JAMA_current reveals a significant gender disparity between the size of research grants awarded to projects led by first-time investigators." https://www.smithsonianmag.com/smart-news/women-science-receive-less-grant-money-their-male-peers-180971649/ …

text: "By considering the policy recommendations ... in this report, Illinois has an opportunity to decrease their rates of firearm homicide and suicide, and serve as a model for other states seeking to reduce the toll of gun violence in their communities."­­

text: "At the height of the shortages, a survey of medical oncologists found that a staggering 83 percent of oncologists weren't able to prescribe their preferred chemotherapy agent."

text: "For most researchers, scaling up presents the biggest hurdle. Replacing the 22 million tons of wild aquaculture fish used every year will require massive volumes of microalgae production."

text: "Direct consequences of drug shortages include increased medication errors, delayed administration of life-saving therapy, inferior outcomes, and patient deaths," says Dr. Yoram Unguru of @BermanInstitute and @HopkinsMedicine. https://hub.jhu.edu/2019/03/05/drug-shortages-for-cancer-health-crisis/ …

text: “These recommendations offer ways to adapt a range of policies and practices that would make it more likely that breast cancer survivors can afford and attain the care they need,” says lead author and @JohnsHopkinsEPI faculty @DrLTDean.

text: Experts from @JHCGPR developed a new report providing "policy recommendations that Illinois should consider as part of its gun violence reduction efforts." The report was supported by the @JoyceFdn. http://www.jhsph.edu/gunpolicy/Illinois …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: A new report from @DrCrifasi, @DanielWWebster1 and @JHCGPR colleagues suggests that purchaser licensing is more effective in reducing firearm homicides when these systems require in-person applications with law enforcement agencies.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "These findings could be a precursor to developing more effective treatments for other virus-related cancers, which account for about 20 percent of cancers worldwide," says @HopkinsMedicine faculty William Sharfman, who served on the research team.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "It may shock you to hear, but over the past 2.5 years, nearly two-thirds of these essential medicines for children with cancer have been or are currently in short supply in the U.S."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: A new report from @DrCrifasi, @DanielWWebster1 and @JHCGPR colleagues outlines 10 policies supported by available research that can help Illinois reduce the number of people killed each year by gun violence. https://hub.jhu.edu/2019/03/04/report-reducing-gun-violence-illinois/ …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: A comprehensive background check system would be a "logical first step" to responsible gun ownership in the U.S. because "you can’t have the other laws function without requiring a background check for every sale,” says @JHCGPR deputy director @DrCrifasi.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “This study offered breast cancer survivors a voice to tell us what they think should be done to make their lives better,” says lead author and @JohnsHopkinsEPI faculty @DrLTDean. https://www.jhsph.edu/news/news-releases/2019/breast-cancer-patients-weigh-in-on-addressing-financial-burdens.html …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “No one should have to make a choice between their health and their money. Yet breast cancer survivors face incredibly high prices that can lead to severe financial hardships, even bankruptcy,” says lead author and @JohnsHopkinsEPI faculty @DrLTDean. https://www.jhsph.edu/news/news-releases/2019/breast-cancer-patients-weigh-in-on-addressing-financial-burdens.html …

text: “If female researchers are receiving less funding then the issues that female researchers are studying are receiving less money,” said @RosemaryJMorgan, a @JohnsHopkinsIH researcher.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “Antibiotic resistance is becoming one of our more persistent problems,” said @JHSPH_CHS's @AmeshAA. “These bacteria are now creeping into the community. There’s really an under-appreciation of the threat of antibiotic resistance.”
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Learn more about the discussion @JohnsHopkinsSPH faculty experts had with @RepDavidTrone, @Call_Me_Dutch, @RepSarbanes and @DanCrenshawTX in this article from the @BaltimoreSun: https://www.baltimoresun.com/health/bs-hs-working-group-on-addition-20190305-story.html …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "One of the challenges is when people forget what a big problem [measles] used to be and then forget why they're actually doing it," @Bruce_Y_Lee, an associate prof. at @JohnsHopkinsSPH, told @BusinessInsider. "Vaccines are a victim of their own success."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "'Vaccination is a foundation of public health safety and measles vaccination is the only effective way to prevent what is otherwise one of the most contagious and deadliest diseases on Earth,' @withyouDrWu said. 'The benefits far outweigh the risks.'"
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: This afternoon @MendelsonTamar, an expert in adolescent mental health at @JohnsHopkinsSPH, was appointed as a Bloomberg Professor of @AmericanHealth. Learn more about Professor Mendelson’s work in this role: https://www.jhsph.edu/news/news-releases/2018/tamar-mendelson-named-bloomberg-professor-of-american-health.html …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Poverty is not inevitable," says @JHUArtsSciences professor @Moffitt_Robert. "We need the public will to address the problem, and for our leaders and legislators to understand why addressing childhood poverty should be a priority."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Establishing a background check system ... likely has an effect," writes @GermanRLopez for @VoxDotCom. "[And] policies that are proven to be far more effective, such as handgun licensing, are built in part on background checks." https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2019/2/27/18224727/house-universal-background-checks-gun-violence-congress …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "We need a way to help scientists organize and preserve, not just index, knowledge," writes @JohnsHopkinsEPI professor @KayDickersin.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Inspired by the simple but significant steps taken in countries like Sudan, we ought to wonder, can mycetoma be eradicated?" write two members of @IFMSA in an exclusive commentary for @GHN_News.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: An initiative to improve quality of care and referrals during pregnancy and childbirth in Indonesia resulted in significant reductions in maternal and newborn mortality, according to a collaborative study by @JohnsHopkinsSPH scientists and @Jhpiego.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "I see a lot of what goes on in global health this way: proponents engaged in an effort to alter the way we perceive the world, and by doing that, they change what's possible," says Jeremy Shiffman, one of the newest @JHU_BDPs at @JohnsHopkins.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Interested in @JTLeek's upcoming lecture on #DataScience as a Scalable Public Health Intervention, but can't make it to campus? Have no fear! All of our Dean's Lectures are recorded and uploaded to YouTube: https://youtube.com/JohnsHopkinsSPH . Scroll down to see a playlist of past lectures.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "If a technology is being tested and perfected to work only under certain conditions, some people are going to miss out," says @JHSPH_HPM faculty Johnathon Ehsani, who's investigating safety and equity in autonomous vehicle technology.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "A key question now is which jurisdiction will open the first sanctioned safe consumption site in the U.S.," says @JHSPH_HPM's @AleneKH, assistant director of @JHSPH_CMHAPR. "Their experience as an early adopter will inform efforts around the country."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: A new report from @JHCGPR identifies weaknesses or gaps in current Illinois law and offers ten recommendations to reduce gun violence. The report was written by @DrCrifasi, @ADMcCourt and @DanielWWebster1. http://www.jhsph.edu/gunpolicy/Illinois …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Implementing comprehensive background checks would be a "logical first step" toward making gun ownership safer, says @JHCGPR director @DanielWWebster1, but as @DrCrifasi expands, for maximum efficacy those checks should be paired with a licensing system.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "I think that many in the general public have the idea that most welfare programs in the U.S. have failed, and that's just not true," says @JHUArtsSciences professor @Moffitt_Robert.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Take a look at @JohnsHopkinsSPH's 2019 Summer Institutes—open to all, online or on campus, opportunities all summer long.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "We really are just getting started," said @drJoshS. https://magazine.jhsph.edu/2019/recap-inaugural-bloomberg-american-health-summit … #AmericanHealthSummit
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Some countries within the mycetoma belt have seen the light, but how many more countries, how many more people are still in the shadows?" ask two members of @IFMSA in an exclusive commentary for @GHN_News.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "This small town has managed, in just five years, to curb its drug epidemic — a rare feat in a country where overdose deaths continue to rise, with more than 70,000 last year alone."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Child poverty is actually very expensive for our country," says @JohnsHopkins's @Moffitt_Robert. "Most of these costs are not visible—they're seen in things like childhood trauma, poor health outcomes, lower educational attainment, and lost productivity." https://hub.jhu.edu/2019/02/28/robert-moffitt-reducing-child-poverty-congress-report/ …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: It's not that universal background checks are "useless" in reducing gun violence, writes @VoxDotCom's @GermanRLopez. It's that "a combination of background check requirement as part of a permitting process" would be more effective, says @DanielWWebster1. https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2019/2/27/18224727/house-universal-background-checks-gun-violence-congress …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “When you couple the background check requirement with a permitting or licensing system for people who want to purchase firearms, specifically handguns, we actually are seeing consistent findings of beneficial effects,” says @JHCGPR's @DanielWWebster1.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Many public health officials see safe consumption sites as a key strategy for combating the nation's escalating drug overdose epidemic. Currently, at least six U.S. states and two cities are pursuing efforts to open these facilities." https://hub.jhu.edu/2019/02/22/safe-consumption-sites-study/ …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Until it recently made the @WHO list of Neglected Tropical Diseases, mycetoma was largely unknown in many parts of the world," write two members of @IFMSA for @GHN_News. "Sudan, however, has been combating mycetoma for several decades." https://www.globalhealthnow.org/2019-02/fighting-flesh-eater-controlling-mycetoma-sub-saharan-africa …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: A new report from the @JHCGPR provides policy recommendations that Illinois should consider to reduce gun violence. The report was written by @DrCrifasi, @ADMcCourt and @DanielWWebster1. http://www.jhsph.edu/gunpolicy/Illinois …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "[There's] a dire need for a global survey to estimate the burden, as well as increased support for mycetoma belt countries trying to adopt national control programs," write two members of @IFMSA in an exclusive commentary for @GHN_News. https://www.globalhealthnow.org/2019-02/fighting-flesh-eater-controlling-mycetoma-sub-saharan-africa …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "If governments want to fund exceptionally risky science, they should do so openly and in a way that promotes public awareness and engagement," write @MLipsitch of @CCDD_HSPH and @JHSPH_CHS director @T_Inglesby.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Little Falls didn’t do anything revolutionary. They just spent real money — at least $1.4 million in state grants since 2014 — on basic public health measures ... In other words, they began treating addiction as a disease instead of a crime." https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/danvergano/overdose-prevention-little-falls-minnesota …

text: “Patient advocacy groups have grown exponentially in the last 10 years, but the magnitude of pharmaceutical industry funding to them across countries has not been measured before,” says lead author and @JHSPH_HPM research associate So-Yeon Kang.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: A new report from @JHCGPR identifies weaknesses or gaps in current Illinois law and offers ten recommendations to reduce gun violence. The report was written by @DrCrifasi, @ADMcCourt and @DanielWWebster1. http://www.jhsph.edu/gunpolicy/Illinois …

text: “If we want to eliminate cholera, we need to be able to count cases accurately and this need is what motivated our study,” says study lead author Andrew Azman, assistant scientist in @JohnsHopkinsEPI.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "There should have been a greater sense of urgency at the FDA then, and there should be a sense of urgency now," writes the @WashingtonPost editorial board in an article on a recent @JAMA_current study from @JohnsHopkinsSPH researchers.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "If we want to measure progress we need to be able to get a better handle on where cholera is and how much there is ... This is one of the first steps in having a data-driven approach to tackling cholera," @JohnsHopkinsEPI assistant scientist Andrew Azman.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "What’s truly unusual about Morrison County is that more places aren’t offering that same coordinated swath of services among doctors, teachers, and law enforcement, drug policy expert @BrendanSaloner of @JohnsHopkinsSPH told @BuzzFeedNews."

text: "Blacks and Latinos make up more than 30% of the U.S. population, but only 10.3% of medical school graduates, a number that hasn't changed much in 50 years."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "The guidelines and interventions in place for responding to specific health emergencies become less effective in the maelstrom of protracted humanitarian disasters," writes @PBSpiegel, director of @JohnsHopkinsIH's Center for @Humanit_Health.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Protracted conflicts are public health crises of the worst magnitude," writes @PBSpiegel, director of @JohnsHopkinsIH's Center for @Humanit_Health. "We need to treat them accordingly." Read the full post on the @WEF website. https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2019/02/we-must-stop-turning-a-blind-eye-to-health-crises …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Given a growing population of seniors who will need assistance, 'I think there’s a need for Medicare to rethink how to better support beneficiaries,' said @AWillin2, co-author of both studies and an assistant scientist at @JohnsHopkinsSPH."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: NEWS: The @JohnsHopkins Center for Communication Programs has been awarded @USAID’s newest five-year, $35 million global knowledge management project. @JohnsHopkinsCCP is based at @JohnsHopkinsSPH.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Later on the same trip, @JohnsHopkinsSPH Dean @EllenJMacKenzie delivered the P.D. Agarwal Memorial Lecture at @IIHMRUniversity in Jaipur. (See below tweet.) You can read @Janprahari's recap online. http://www.janprahari.com/nearly-1-million-injury-deaths-per-year-india-dr-ellen-mackenzie/ …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "The [@JHCGPR] report concludes that while Illinois has relatively strong laws, there remains several ways it could improve them to try to prevent guns from winding up in the hands of people who commit violence."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Complex humanitarian disasters often fade into the background," writes @Humanit_Health director @PBSpiegel. "The damage they wreak on public health goes unseen, until a singular image drives media coverage and public scrutiny." https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2019/02/we-must-stop-turning-a-blind-eye-to-health-crises …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “The policies and strategies outlined in this report are applicable to other states considering evidence-based approaches to reduce firearm homicide and suicide and don’t infringe upon the rights of law-abiding gun owners,” says @JHCGPR's @DrCrifasi. https://www.jhsph.edu/news/news-releases/2019/report-offers-evidence-based-recommendations-aimed-at-reducing-illinois-gun-violence.html …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: This week, Dr. @IBhushan, CEO of #AyushmanBharat (and @JohnsHopkinsSPH @JHU_Alumni!), welcomed Heath Elliott, #JHSPH's associate dean for external affairs, to discuss India's ambitious healthcare project. You can read more about the initiative in @GHN_News https://www.globalhealthnow.org/2018-04/500-million-people-need-health-insurance-call-indu-bhushan …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "The study, by researchers from @JohnsHopkinsSPH ... shows that about one-third of older adults who live in the community — nearly 13 million seniors — have a substantial need for assistance with daily activities" https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/health-science/for-older-people-who-stay-in-their-homes-help-is-needed-but-often-is-inadequate/2019/02/22/591ed0de-3540-11e9-854a-7a14d7fec96a_story.html …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: If you’re seeing these tweets about #UrgencyOfNow2019, and want to watch online, visit this page for the webcast link: https://www.jhsph.edu/research/centers-and-institutes/johns-hopkins-center-for-health-equity/news-and-events/index.html … cc: @JHhealthequity @JohnsHopkins
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: US consumer survey: widespread confusion about food date labels is leading to increased #foodwaste. http://ow.ly/kkTr30nKV81  @ncl_tweets @HarvardFLPC @livablefuture
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Follow @JHhealthequity for live updates throughout this afternoon’s #UrgencyOfNow2019 event, a special symposium to honor the life of Dr. Shalon Irving and to advance an agenda to eliminate racial disparities in maternal health. Livestream available: https://www.jhsph.edu/research/centers-and-institutes/johns-hopkins-center-for-health-equity/news-and-events/index.html …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "The United States is most dangerous place in the developed world to give birth--and the mothers most at risk … are African Americans." This afternoon @JohnsHopkins is convening experts for ideas on "how to change that picture." http://www.wypr.org/post/maternal-mortality-and-being-black-woman-america … #UrgencyOfNow2019
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "It's very important, even though we all have our own political views, for humanitarians to be seen as neutral and independent," says @Humanit_Health director @PBSpiegel in an @NPRatc interview on the humanitarian crisis in Venezuela.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “That opioid crashes in Maryland over the last 10 years have been more or less steady was a surprise,” said @JHSPH_HPM faculty Johnathon Ehsani, “because Maryland is one of those states that has been quite severely affected by the overall opioid epidemic.”
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "While Maryland is facing a growing epidemic of opioid addiction, there has not been a corresponding increase in traffic fatalities involving drivers who have the drug in their systems, a new report examining data from the state medical examiner found." https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/trafficandcommuting/opioid-use-is-high-in-maryland-but-fatal-car-crashes-involving-drivers-with-the-drug-in-their-system-have-not-increased/2019/02/19/ded2aefa-3458-11e9-af5b-b51b7ff322e9_story.html …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "The study found that thousands of patients received the drug who shouldn't have. In fact, it says, more than half of those who used the restricted fentanyl should never have been prescribed it."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: In the new study published online in @ScienceTM, the researchers developed machine-learning algorithms that use results from multiple cholera antibody tests to accurately identify individuals recently infected.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "As many as half the patients who were prescribed potent fentanyl painkillers designed for people battling cancer should not have received the drug from doctors"
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: A new study by @JHSPH_HPM researchers found that U.S.-based patient advocacy organizations received a disproportionate amount of contributions made by the world’s 10 largest pharmaceutical companies in 2016.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Algorithms using data from antibody signatures in peoples’ blood may enable scientists to assess the size of cholera outbreaks and identify hotspots of cholera transmission more accurately than ever, according to a study led by @JohnsHopkinsSPH scientists. https://www.jhsph.edu/news/news-releases/2019/new-tool-for-tracking-cholera-outbreaks-could-make-it-easier-to-detect-and-stop-deadly-epidemics.html …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: A survey analysis by @LivableFuture's @RNeff1, @HarvardFLPC, and @NCL_tweets finds that misunderstanding of food "Best By" or "Use By" labels is linked with higher food discards.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "The algorithm, which analyses antibodies in blood samples to estimate cholera incidence in a region, is a major step towards a data-driven understanding of the disease."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "A study by @JohnsHopkinsSPH found that one safe consumption space in Baltimore could prevent 5 percent of overdose deaths in a year and save $6 million in costs related to drug deaths."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "What we found was that several years after the program was started, there were alarming deficiencies identified, and yet little was done by the FDA and drug manufacturers to effectively address these problems," said @JohnsHopkinsSPH's Caleb Alexander. https://us.cnn.com/2019/02/19/health/fentanyl-study/index.html …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “This study brings to light the realities of how such an innovation could be implemented, the nature of the stakeholders and the complexity and uniqueness of each city’s process,” says @SusanSherman.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “The million-dollar question is, how on earth did such high rates of unsafe use occur when these products were subject to one of the most restrictive distribution systems that the FDA and manufacturers have?” https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2019/02/19/fentanyl-over-prescribed-patients-study-finds-johns-hopkins-fda-painkillers-cancer/2920034002/ …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: New survey of US consumers found widespread confusion about food date labels, leading to increased #foodwaste, especially among the 18 – 34 age group. http://ow.ly/kkTr30nKV81  @ncl_tweets @HarvardFLPC @livablefuture
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: It's not a matter of if there will be another pandemic, says @JohnsHopkinsEPI associate scientist Emily Gurley (PhD '12). It's a matter of when, and which disease it will be. One of her focuses is making sure it's not Nipah.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “Compared to many other states, Illinois has relatively strong firearm laws overall, yet many opportunities exist for the state to strengthen their approach to reducing the diversion of guns for criminal use and gun violence,” says @JHCGPR's @DrCrifasi. https://www.jhsph.edu/news/news-releases/2019/report-offers-evidence-based-recommendations-aimed-at-reducing-illinois-gun-violence.html …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “What is most important now is for this process to be made transparent to the public and to the scientific community so they have a chance to decide if this work is worth the potential consequences,” says @JHSPH_CHS director @T_Inglesby.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "We found alarming use of these products in patients who never should have received them," said senior study author & @JohnsHopkinsSPH prof. Caleb Alexander. "The prescribing of this medicine was supposed to be closely monitored and contained but was not." https://us.cnn.com/2019/02/19/health/fentanyl-study/index.html …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “We have an approach here that other countries have found helpful in reaching a marginalized population that faces high rates of mortality. A key question now is which jurisdiction will open the first sanctioned safe consumption site in the U.S.”
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "I hope we begin to treat people who use drugs with respect and compassion," says @AmericanHealth fellow Alison Miller. "I think that’s really critical because stigmatization is such a huge problem." https://americanhealth.jhu.edu/article/qa-alison-miller …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “As date labeling becomes standardized, this research underlines the need for a strong communications campaign and highlights a particular need for education among those ages 18 to 34,” says @LivableFuture's @RNeff1.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: A new @LivableFuture study calls attention to the issue that much food may be discarded unnecessarily based on food safety concerns, though relatively few food items are likely to become unsafe before becoming unpalatable. https://www.jhsph.edu/news/news-releases/2019/survey-misunderstanding-food-date-labels-linked-with-higher-food-discards.html …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: A new qualitative study from @JHSPH_HPM and @JHSPH_CMHAPR researchers identifies several key lessons from early efforts to establish sanctioned safe consumption sites in five U.S. communities. https://www.jhsph.edu/news/news-releases/2019/safe-consumption-sites-study-identifies-policy-change-strategies-and-challenges.html …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: A new survey examined U.S. consumer attitudes and behaviors related to food date labels, and an analysis led by @LivableFuture researchers found widespread confusion, leading to unnecessary discards, increased waste and food safety risks. https://www.jhsph.edu/news/news-releases/2019/survey-misunderstanding-food-date-labels-linked-with-higher-food-discards.html …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Rupali Limaye, an associate director at @JohnsHopkinsSPH’s Institute for Vaccine Safety, says that it’s important for providers to 'not be dismissive,' of parents who have concerns about vaccines, 'but not confirm their concerns.'"
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Thanks to intensive surveillance efforts over the past 15 years, [Emily] Gurley says we now know more about how to stop Nipah than we do many other emerging infectious diseases. 'We know how to prevent transmission of Nipah from wildlife to people.'"
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “We should not be encouraging people to avoid parenthood to work in STEM fields,” says @JHSPH_HPM professor @withyouDrWu. “What we need to change is how we design our work.”
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Due to inclement weather, @JohnsHopkinsSPH will be closed Wednesday (2/20). For updates and weather alerts regarding all of @JohnsHopkins, please visit: https://www.jhu.edu/alert/
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “Both the @US_FDA and the fentanyl makers failed to design and implement an effective monitoring program,” says study senior author and @JohnsHopkinsEPI professor Caleb Alexander, who co-directs @JohnsHopkinsSPH's Center for Drug Safety and Effectiveness.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "It’s important to understand what drugs are involved in overdoses so prevention efforts can be targeted effectively," notes @AmericanHealth fellow Alison Miller. "You usually can’t get that information from emergency departments or death certificates." https://americanhealth.jhu.edu/article/qa-alison-miller …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “Most people are not truly anti-vaccine, they just have questions and concerns,” says Dr. Rupali Limaye, an assistant scientist with @JohnsHopkinsIH and the Institute for Vaccine Safety at @JohnsHopkinsSPH. http://time.com/5527802/mother-convinced-vaccinate-children/ …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "If this were #Ebola or the flu, and this many people died, think about what the public health and political response would be," says @JohnsHopkinsSPH professor @SusanSherman in a segment with @Bryce_Newberry of @CronkiteNews.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: The third annual "@JohnsHopkins Day" at the @LewisMuseum will be held from 10 a.m. until 5 p.m. on Saturday, Feb. 23. All Johns Hopkins faculty, staff, students, and their families will be offered free admission in celebration of #BlackHistoryMonth.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Under Arizona law, small test strips that could prevent drug overdose can be considered “drug paraphernalia.” In an interview with @Bryce_Newberry of @CronkiteNews, @JohnsHopkinsSPH professor @SusanSherman explains why science should inform the policy.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "We use the expression 'just show up' at the @Nov_Project frequently," writes @MarvinTheTorch, a @JohnsHopkinsSPH MPH student who founded @Nov_Proj_Balt. "That's the first step in whatever we hope to achieve—in public health or in life."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: In the year since the tragedy in Parkland, FL, one of the most important developments has been “an expansion of youth activism and involvement in the political process,” says @JHCGPR director @DanielWWebster1.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "A study like this can be used to inform and change drug paraphernalia laws," professor @SusanSherman tells @Bryce_Newberry of @CronkiteNews. "People actually don’t even know if testing in every state is legal or criminalized. Science can inform policy"
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Practicing high-quality care requires a human touch. That will never go away," writes @withyouDrWu. "The great irony today is that artificial intelligence may prove to be the force that helps bring that human touch back to the forefront of medicine."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Maryland passed a GVRO law (also called an ERPO or "red flag" law) last October. In an interview with @KojoShow, @JHCGPR faculty Shannon Frattaroli describes what these laws look like and whether they can help reduce gun violence.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “If a technology is being tested and perfected to work only under certain conditions, some people are going to miss out” on the potential benefits of AVs, says Johnathon Ehsani, an assistant professor in @JHSPH_HPM.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: With funding from the Guyer Scholarship, Radhika Raghunathan hopes to explore the multiple determinants of child and family well-being and continue to push the boundaries of innovation in the field of maternal and child health.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: It's not enough for autonomous vehicles to be safe. @JohnsHopkinsSPH faculty are also making sure they're equitable. https://magazine.jhsph.edu/2019/all-inclusive-equity-autonomous-vehicle-safety-testing …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: On Saturday, Feb. 23, all @JohnsHopkins faculty, staff, students, and their families will be offered free admission to the @LewisMuseum in celebration of #BlackHistoryMonth.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “We hope the findings help clinicians, policy and program decision-makers determine which risk factors to address and re-address when caring for adults with HIV so that they can not only live long lives, but live long lives in good health” – @KeriNAlthoff
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "We really are just getting started," said @drJoshS. #AmericanHealthSummit
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Congratulations @JHSPH_HPM's Beth McGinty, who received a $50,000 @JohnsHopkins presidential gift to support her work, which aims to reduce stigma surrounding mental illness and substance use disorders and increase support for individuals facing them.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Machine learning applications and AI won’t solve every issue with using an electronic health record (EHR) system, writes @JHSPH_HPM professor @withyouDrWu, "but they can significantly reduce much of the data 'noise.'"
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Experts such as @JHCGPR's @DrCrifasi believe that raising the minimum purchasing age is a promising policy because of the risks associated with guns in the hands of adolescents.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "When it comes to repeat offending for people who commit sexual offenses as youths, it is not past behavior that indicates risk but 'recent past behavior,' [says @eletourn.]"
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: What effects do so-called GVRO (also called ERPO or "red flag" laws) have on gun violence in states where they've been adopted? @JHSPH_HPM / @JHCGPR faculty Shannon Frattaroli discusses the evidence on the @KojoShow. https://wamu.org/story/19/02/07/what-we-know-about-marylands-red-flag-law/ …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: In an article on three emerging technologies that could help physicians deal with electronic health records (EHR) systems, @JHSPH_HPM professor @withyouDrWu shouts out a machine-learning-based system developed by @SuchiSaria and used at @HopkinsMedicine. https://www.forbes.com/sites/insights-intelai/2019/02/11/solving-healthcares-big-epidemicphysician-burnout/#5b53205a4483 …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “Addressing and preventing traditional risk factors for severe age-related diseases can greatly reduce the burden of such diseases in adults with HIV,” @KeriNAlthoff, @JohnsHopkinsEPI faculty, told @InfectDisNews. https://www.healio.com/infectious-disease/hiv-aids/news/in-the-journals/%7B7080dd6a-d53d-4a6a-901e-0ba8af04bbc9%7D/traditional-risk-factors-contribute-greatly-to-disease-in-adults-with-hiv …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: In a conversation with guests on the @KojoShow, @JHSPH_HPM / @JHCGPR faculty Shannon Frattaroli discusses GVRO laws (also called ERPO or "red flag" laws) and their effects on gun violence in the states where similar types of laws have been adopted. https://wamu.org/story/19/02/07/what-we-know-about-marylands-red-flag-law/ …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "One of the most effective ways of keeping kids safe from guns is one of the simplest: requiring people to safely store their weapons." https://www.thetrace.org/2019/02/kids-gun-violence-strategies/ …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "I think people take it for granted that the healthcare system must be responding," says Neel Koyawala, who studied follow-up treatment on people who overdosed. "But we're clearly not doing enough despite the significance of the opioid crisis right now."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "I’ve been studying gun violence and our response to it for about 30 years, and I have never seen such swift and dramatic action," @JHCGPR director @DanielWWebster1 tells @Nightline. Watch the full segment online: https://abcnews.go.com/Nightline/video/wire-fox-terrier-wins-best-show-61041977 … #NeverAgain
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "None of us can sit by and let those who oppose vaccines continue to make headway," writes @JohnsHopkinsCCP executive director @SusanKrennCCP. "There has been too much damage done already."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "We are at a unique moment in moving forward to address the opioid crisis. We must not leave surgical patients behind," writes @JohnsHopkinsSPH faculty Dr. Caleb Alexander along with @Stanford faculty Drs. Sesh Mudumbai and Randall Stafford.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Certainly! We’ll post links to the recording as soon as it becomes available, so stay tuned in the coming days. In the meantime, past Dean’s Lectures can be watched on a playlist on our @YouTube page. It’s the “Featured Lectures” link on this page:
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "More than three-quarters (78%) of physicians experience periodic feelings of professional burnout, a jump of 4% from 2016," writes @JHSPH_HPM professor @withyouDrWu, who identifies three areas where "technology can improve physicians’ lives."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Maryland passed a GVRO law (a.k.a. ERPO or "red flag" law) last October. Recently, the @KojoShow invited @AlanaWise_, @MCPnews Sheriff Darren Popkin, @JHSPH_HPM/@JHCGPR faculty Shannon Frattaroli and others to discuss their effects on reducing gun violence
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Only 13 states have gun violence restraining order (GVRO) laws, also called "red flag" or extreme risk protection order (ERPO) laws, most of which were passed after Parkland. Early evidence of their effectiveness is promising.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "The main implication of the study is that opioid overdoses are major life events and big opportunities for the healthcare system to increase appropriate treatment for individuals who experienced an overdose."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “It continues to surprise me that we recognize that children cannot consent to sexual behavior because they lack the information, maturation and development, but we will hold them accountable as adults for sexual behavior,” said @eletourn.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "The high rate of child gun deaths is a uniquely American problem. But there are evidence-based solutions that can save lives." https://www.thetrace.org/2019/02/kids-gun-violence-strategies/ …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “To have public defenders, public health, law enforcement, [and] prosecutors sitting together coming up with solutions is no small thing,” said @SusanSherman. “It’s a systems change.”
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Debarati Guha-Sapir, director of @CREDUCL, is among the scientists working to improve methods for estimating death tolls. A new article in @Nature provides an overview of this complicated quest and the @JohnsHopkinsSPH alumna's journey toward success.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: .@JohnsHopkins will open at 10 a.m. on Tuesday, Feb. 12. To see the latest information as well as updates on shuttle schedules, please visit: https://www.jhu.edu/alert/
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: Due to inclement weather, @JohnsHopkinsSPH will operate on an adjusted schedule Tuesday (2/12). Please use caution on the roadways and sidewalks. For schedule details and updated alerts regarding all of @JohnsHopkins, please visit: https://www.jhu.edu/alert/
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “Scaling up treatment services in settings where HCV testing is offered may help to improve the HCV care continuum,” says @JohnsHopkinsSPH doctoral student Catelyn Coyle.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: “A 12-year-old who hasn’t reoffended sexually for 10 years is no more likely to do so than you or I,” said @eletourn. “It’s as simple as that.” https://cumberlink.com/news/local/closer_look/kids-in-cuffs-reaching-back-in-time-to-charge-adults/article_c5f2ac40-94d8-5025-a83c-9baea6a122fb.html …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Determining how many people died in a disaster is more than just academic bean counting, says [@JohnsHopkinsSPH alumna] Debarati Guha-Sapir, epidemiologist and director of @CREDUCL in Louvain-la-Neuve, Belgium." https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-019-00442-0 …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Have vaccines become victims of their own success?" asks @JohnsHopkinsCCP executive director @SusanKrennCCP.
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "According to the study, the cancer incidence increases were particularly severe in six of the 12 obesity-related cancers. These include cancers of the colon, uterine, gallbladder, kidney and pancreas, and multiple myeloma — a bone marrow cancer."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "Our key message is that we can be better and we must be better," says @JHSPH_HPM and @JohnsHopkinsDMH faculty @BrendanSaloner. "There is no choice, really."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "As long as there have been vaccines, a portion of the population has been opposed to them," writes @SusanKrennCCP. "But in this age of distrust and fear ... this population appears to be growing and becoming more dangerous to public health." https://www.baltimoresun.com/news/opinion/oped/bs-ed-op-0205-childhood-vaccinations-20190204-story.html …
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "With the number of research participants studied as long as they were studied, we should have been able to see a statistically significant difference in pain reduction if these creams were actually working. But we didn't see this in our data."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH

text: "William Moss, a specialist in epidemiology and immunology at @JohnsHopkinsSPH, told @Newsweek that this year could be the worst for measles cases since 1989."
author: JohnsHopkinsSPH
